page.title: 18HERITAGE TRUST
page.content: {FRINTON AND WALTON HERITAGE TRUST} THIS WAS FOUNDED BY A GROUP OF VOLUNTEERS JUST OVER A YEAR AGO. THE TRUST AIMS TO PRESERVE AND IMPROVE THE ENVIRONMENT. A RECENT MAJOR PROJECT HAS BEEN THE RESTORATION OF THE OLD LIFEBOAT HOUSE AT WALTON ON THE NAZE. THE SECOND PROJECT HAS BEEN THE RESTORATION OF THE RAILWAY STATION AT FRINTON. IN RECENT YEARS THE STATION WAITING ROOM HAS BEEN VANDALISED AND LEFT IN A DIRTY STATE. THE TRUST HAS CLEANED IT UP AND REPLACED THE CARPET. BRITISH RAIL HAS HAD THE CHAIRS RECOVERED AND THE FLOOR SANDED AND POLISHED. THE WAITING ROOM IS NOW AS ATTRACTIVE AS IT WAS WHEN QUEEN MARY SAW IT IN THE 1930'S. THE MOST RECENT PROJECT IS THE CLEANING UP OF THE SIGNALMAN'S COTTAGE GARDEN AT FRINTON STATION. TENDRING HIGH SCHOOL CHILDREN HAVE MADE A START ON THIS JOB.
